alert.note: Alert for Animas River Basin; Central Gunnison and Uncompahgre River Basin; Four Corners, Upper Dolores River; Grand Valley; Northwestern San Juan Mountains; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Southwest San Juan Mountains; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide; Upper Gunnison River Valley; West Elk and Sawatch Mountains (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 24 at 6:29PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...SNOW SQUALL... HAZARDS...A snow squall accompanied by winds of up to 30 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 629 PM MDT, a snow squall was along a line extending from near Delta to 9 miles south of Cortez and moving east at 20 MPH. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Montrose, Delta, Cortez, Orchard City, Telluride, Olathe, Mancos, Mountain Village, Dolores, Ridgway, Nucla, Naturita, Norwood, Crawford, Rico, Sawpit, Loghill Village, La Plata, Ophir and Mayday. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 550 in Colorado between mile markers 100 and 130. U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 56 and 110. U.S. Highway 491 in Colorado between mile markers 27 and 50. U.S. Highway 160 in Colorado between mile markers 20 and 73. Colorado 62 between mile markers 1 and 23. Colorado 65 between mile markers 1 and 2. Colorado 90 between mile markers 82 and 89. Colorado 92 between mile markers 1 and 8, between mile markers 25 and 42, and between mile markers 45 and 47. Colorado 140 between mile markers 5 and 18, and near mile marker 23. Colorado 141 between mile markers 37 and 61. Colorado 145 between mile markers 1 and 116. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this squall. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
